subject: p10959054
Findings: Frontal and lateral views of the chest were obtained. There is a small right pleural effusion with some fluid seen tracking in the minor fissure and which may be partially loculated. Scattered patchy opacities projecting predominantly over the right lung raises concern for an infection, less likely asymmetric edema. There is left basilar atelectasis. The lungs are relatively hyperinflated with flattening of the diaphragms, suggesting chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. The cardiac and mediastinal silhouettes are relatively stable.
